intro: Pectis vandevenderi, commonly known as the Vandevender's pectis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cylindrical shape. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
